New Records: Tarik Skubal struck out 201 in a season, joining Hal Newhouser, Mickey Lolich, and Matthew Boyd as the only left-handers to achieve this for the team

Trey Sweeney drove in two runs with a double

Pre-Game Insights: Jack Morris threw the ceremonial first pitch to Lance Parrish
The game was played on 1984 World Series championship night

Post-Match Reflections: A.J. Hinch praised Tarik Skubal's performance
Alex Cora commented on the significance of the game for both teams
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rich Hill was the only player on either roster born when the Tigers last won the World Series
The Tigers moved within 1 1/2 games of Boston for fourth in the American League wild-card race
